item.title: Bulletin updated at 12:02 HKT 23/08/2022
item.description:
At noon at the Hong Kong Observatory :
Air temperature : 32 degrees Celsius
Relative Humidity : 70 per cent
During the past hour the mean UV Index recorded at King's Park : 9
Intensity of UV radiation : very high

According to the present forecast track, Tropical Cyclone Ma-on will move across the vicinity of the northern part of Luzon and Luzon Strait during the day today (23 August). It is expected to come within 800 km of Hong Kong tonight. The Observatory will consider issuing the Standby Signal, No.1 then. The forecast track and intensity of Ma-on remain uncertain under the influence of terrain of Luzon. After entering the northeastern part of the South China Sea, Ma-on will move northwestwards, edging closer to the coast of Guangdong gradually. The local weather will deteriorate significantly and winds will strengthen gradually later tomorrow (24 August). Winds will strengthen further on Thursday (25 August). There will be heavy squally showers, very rough to high seas and swells. Under the influence of storm surge, low-lying areas may have flooding or backflow of seawater. Please be alert of the latest information issued by the Observatory and complete appropriate precautions against strong winds, heavy showers, and flooding as soon as possible.

Please be reminded that:
The Very Hot Weather Warning is now in force. The public should beware of heatstroke and drink more water.
